message: I have a high-quality product for you. It's worth at least $150 to me, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. If you don't buy it, I'll just have to sell it to someone else for a lower price, so you're getting a great deal. Plus, I've had great feedback from other customers who have purchased from me in the past. What do you say?
I appreciate your offer, but I'd like to wait and see the next product before making a decision.

No pressure, I completely understand. Let me tell you, this next product is even better than the last one. It's also a high-quality item, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to give you a special deal on this one - if you buy it, I'll throw in a free accessory that's worth at least $20. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it because I'm confident you'll appreciate the value. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see the next product before making a decision.

Alright, I get it. You're a tough negotiator. Let me be upfront with you - this next product is the best one I have left. It's a high-quality item, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the full $100, no strings attached. If you don't buy it, I'll have to start selling the lower-quality products, and I'm not sure I'll be able to get a good price for them. This is your last chance to get a high-quality product at a great price. What do you say?
I'll take the product. I'm willing to take the risk and hope it's a high-quality one.

Congratulations on making a great decision! You won't regret it. Now, let me ask you, how did you feel about the product you just purchased? Was it worth the $100 to you? Your feedback will help me improve my sales strategy. And, by the way, I have another high-quality product available for you, which is similar to the one you just bought. I'm glad I made a good decision with the previous product, but I'm not sure I want to take on the risk again. I'd like to wait and see the next product before making another decision.

I completely understand your caution. Let me give you some more information. I've sold a total of 3 high-quality products to 3 different customers, and all of them have been very satisfied. The one you bought earlier is one of them. I'm not just making this up, I have a record of all my sales. This next product is also a high-quality one, and I'm willing to give you a guarantee: if you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. What do you say?
I appreciate the guarantee, and with the additional information, I'm willing to take the risk again. I'll buy the current product.

I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'm not comfortable buying without a guarantee, so I'll have to pass on this one.
